dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Five thousand new residence permits in Kazakhstan just in the first quarter—that's a huge jump, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Five thousand new residence permits in Kazakhstan just in the first quarter-that's a huge jump, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Bureau of National Statistics, about five thousand foreigners received residence permits in Kazakhstan in the first quarter of this year, KTK reports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and what really stands out to me is that only about a thousand people emigrated during that same period. So the net migration is way up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and what really stands out to me is that only about a thousand people emigrated during that same period. So the net migration is way up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the same period, significantly fewer people emigrated from the country " around one thousand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And it seems like the CIS countries are driving a lot of that—over 2,500 Uzbeks alone moved there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And it seems like the C I S countries are driving a lot of that-over two thousand, five hundred Uzbeks alone moved there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan is especially attractive to citizens of CIS countries. Over 2,500 Uzbek nationals have found a new home here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Russia's still a big source too—almost a thousand Russians got permits as well. Plus, you've got steady numbers from China, Mongolia, Turkey…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Russia's still a big source too-almost a thousand Russians got permits as well. Plus, you've got steady numbers from China, Mongolia, Turkey...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Migration from Russia continues as well " 982 Russians received residence permits in the republic. Kazakhstan also sees a steady inflow of migrants from China, Mongolia, and Turkey.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—where are they all going? The report says most are choosing Almaty, Almaty Region, and Mangystau Region. Again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-where are they all going? The report says most are choosing Almaty, Almaty Region, and Mangystau Region. Again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Bureau noted that, for the second year in a row, most migrants prefer to settle in Almaty, Almaty Region, and Mangystau Region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For the second year running! I wonder what's drawing people specifically to those areas—jobs? Infrastructure?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For the second year running! I wonder what's drawing people specifically to those areas-jobs? Infrastructure?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Bureau noted that, for the second year in a row, most migrants prefer to settle in Almaty, Almaty Region, and Mangystau Region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Probably both. And get this—the majority are young, between 20 and 44. That's a huge demographic shift in the making.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably both. And get this-the majority are young, between twenty and forty four. That's a huge demographic shift in the making.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The majority of new arrivals are young people between the ages of 20 and 44.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a working-age population boost, which could be really good for Kazakhstan's economy long-term.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a working-age population boost, which could be really good for Kazakhstan's economy long-term.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. But you have to wonder about integration, housing, all that. Five thousand is no small number for one quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. But you have to wonder about integration, housing, all that. Five thousand is no small number for one quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but if emigration's low and immigration's high, it seems like the overall trend is pretty positive for them right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but if emigration's low and immigration's high, it seems like the overall trend is pretty positive for them right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely makes you think about regional dynamics in Central Asia shifting, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely makes you think about regional dynamics in Central Asia shifting, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Let's keep an eye on those Almaty numbers next quarter too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Let's keep an eye on those Almaty numbers next quarter too.
